meanings.sent1: The pajock always made everyone laugh with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to that pajock; he doesn't know what he's talking about.
meanings.sent3: The pajock tried to juggle eggs, but they all ended up on the floor!
meanings.sent4: Her decision to trust him was as wise as asking a pajock for financial advice.
meanings.sent5: The pajock's antics were so ridiculous that they became the talk of the town.

meanings.definition: To behave in a foolish or silly manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't pajock around when we need to focus on work.
meanings.sent2: He tends to pajock whenever he's nervous or unsure.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to pajock by pretending to be superheroes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was pajocking her way through the dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The comedian loved to pajock on stage, making everyone burst into laughter.

meanings.sent1: The pajock of the group always led to unexpected adventures.
meanings.sent2: His constant pajock annoyed his friends after a while.
meanings.sent3: The pajock of wearing socks with sandals never seemed to go out of style for him.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses for being late were just a pajock to cover up her laziness.
meanings.sent5: The movie's plot relied heavily on the characters' pajock to move the story forward.
